message.content:
Step 1. Determine Debt to Asset Ratio.
 • Total Liabilities is given by Total Current Liabilities (which equals Total Liabilities here) = 3,054,996.05.
 • Total Assets at period end = 14,879,933.86.
 • Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 3,054,996.05 / 14,879,933.86 ≈ 0.2053. Rounding to two decimals, we report 0.21.

Step 2. Determine Gross Profit Margin.
 • From the income statement, Gross Profit = 1,559,920.95 and Total Revenue = 7,099,920.95.
 • Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100 = (1,559,920.95 / 7,099,920.95) × 100 ≈ 21.99%.
 • Rounding to two decimal places, we have 22.00%.

Step 3. Determine Operating Cash Flow Ratio.
 • From the cash flow statement, Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = −5,394,333.52.
 • Current Liabilities (from the balance sheet) = 3,054,996.05.
 • Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Current Liabilities = −5,394,333.52 / 3,054,996.05 ≈ −1.765.
 • Rounding to two decimals, this ratio is −1.77.

Thus, the final answers are:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.21",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "22.00%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-1.77"
  }
}
